definition: canvass for contributions/to recruit/to collect/to raise
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)

sentences.english: Our vicar is always raising money for one cause or another.
sentences.chinese: 我们的牧师老是在为这桩或那桩事募款。

sentences.english: The children were formed into small groups, which went from door to door collecting money and old colthes.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们分成几个小组，挨家挨户地募款和旧衣服。

sentences.english: MIT Habitat supports local HFH affiliates through volunteer labor and fundraising.
sentences.chinese: 他们透过志工和募款的方法支援当地的HFH联盟。

sentences.english: He put the rock up for sale on an a auction site to raise money for earthquake victims.
sentences.chinese: 他把这颗巨石放上拍卖网以为地震遇难者募款。

sentences.english: McCain hopes to benefit this week from fundraising help from President Bush.
sentences.chinese: 麦凯恩希望本周能在布什总统帮助募款的努力下得益。

sentences.english: Our charity solicits funds from both governmental agencies and private enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 我们的慈善机构向政府和私人企业募款。

sentences.english: Volunteers manage fundraising as well as promotional and educational programs.
sentences.chinese: 义工则协助募款并奖掖教育计画。

sentences.english: We wanted something very public but also where we could do a lot of good, not just PR.” Coincidentally, the National Zoo was raising funds for the panda project.
sentences.chinese: 当时恰逢国家动物园在为熊猫项目募款。

definition: joint signatures (on a letter or declaration)
Tung Wah Group of Hospitals (Hong Kong)

pinyin: Xiang1 gang3 Hong2 Shi2 zi4 hui4

definition: to donate blood/also written 供血
Ketagalan, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan, esp. northeast corner
